intro: Sasamorpha purpurascens f. psilostachys, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sasamorpha, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically narrower than those of the typical species. The plant produces showy, pinkish to reddish bracts that resemble flowers, though they are not true flowers. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Indonesia. This ornamental plant is often cultivated for its striking foliage and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
